meanings.definition: To move to a new place.
meanings.sent1: The family is relocating to a bigger house next month.
meanings.sent2: She is relocating to a different city for her new job.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to be relocating its favorite toy all around the house.
meanings.sent4: The idea of relocating to a tropical island sounds like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The company is relocating its headquarters to a more central location for better access.

meanings.definition: The act of moving to a new place.
meanings.sent1: The relocating of the office caused some disruption in the workflow.
meanings.sent2: Her relocating to a different country was a big decision.
meanings.sent3: The relocating of the penguins to a new exhibit was quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The relocating of the books from one shelf to another took hours.
meanings.sent5: The relocating of the museum artifacts required careful planning and handling.
